alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued August 24 at 8:03AM AKDT until August 25 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 4 PM AKDT THURSDAY FROM KIPNUK TO THE MOUTH OF THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER... The National Weather Service in Anchorage has issued a High Surf Advisory, which is in effect from 7 AM to 4 PM AKDT Thursday. * LOCATION...The southern Kuskokwim Delta Coastline, from Kipnuk to the mouth of the Kuskokwim River * WAVES AND SURF...Storm surge will generally be 4 to 6 feet above the normal highest tide line. Offshore waves in the Kuskokwim Bay will be 4 to 8 feet through this period. * TIMING...From 7AM to 4PM Thursday. The period of highest impact will be around 11AM. * IMPACTS...Incoming higher waves along the coastline could produce areas of localized rip currents and beach erosion.
info.instruction: A high surf advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing rip currents and localized beach erosion.
